page.title: 01Introduction to Mayfield
page.content: Mayfield is a Wealden Village of about 3,500 inhabitants,9 miles south of Tunbridge Wells,21 miles north of Eastbourne,& 42 miles from London.The main A 267 Eastbourne_Tunbridge Wells road runs through the centre of Mayfield. Mayfield in 1985 is a "Dormitory Village,"with no real large employer meaning that people commute to work in the surrounding towns & London each day.The local farms do provide some employment however. Many buildings in Mayfield are very old,from 15th_18th centuries,and there are only a very few new ones.Some of the houses are very large,there are a lot of bungalows but few flats. Public transport is poor;most families have a car. Mayfield has a lot of old people who have retired here.
